alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon; Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Pueblo County Including Pueblo; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 2:57PM MDT until March 23 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect for portions of the southeast plains this afternoon through this evening. ...A Red Flag Warning has been issued for the southern I-25 corridor tomorrow afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228, 229, 230, 232, AND 233... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228, 229, 230, 232, AND 233... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 228, 229, 230, 232 and 233. * Timing...the Warning for today expires at 9 pm. The warning for tomorrow is in effect from noon to 7 pm. * Winds...For the rest of today, West 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. For tomorrow, southwest 25 to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Impacts...Blowing dust could dramatically reduce visibility. Any fire that starts will rapidly spread. If you smell smoke, report it to local authorities.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
